title: Simulation/VR-Based Tool Utilization Strategies for University Mathematics Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts and experience in using educational tools
context.additional_context: An instructional design strategy training course for developing university mathematics instructional design tools.

learning_goals: Learners can apply at least three math instructional design frameworks in simulation/VR environments.
Learners can develop at least two formative assessment-centered lesson materials using learning design support tools.
Learners can improve their competency in visualizing math concepts via digital devices (20% enhancement in pre-post assessments).
Learners can acquire the ability to design flexible instructional strategies for medium-sized learner groups.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
